Comment: I think a lot of it will come down to how confident they are of their ability to manipulate the outcome of the midterm elections. All of the Republicans, MAGA and "moderate" alike, are absolutely chomping at the bit to take a chainsaw to Medicaid. But they also know that a huge number of MAGA voters rely on Medicaid. So for the Representatives in nominally vulnerable or purple districts, cutting life-saving care from 70 million Americans to hand those billions of dollars to their billionaire friends would, at least in theory, result in an electoral bloodbath - *if* the 2026 elections were free, fair, and non-manipulated. If, on the other hand, they can arrange things in a way that the vast majority of people either won't be able to vote, or they'd be able to count only the votes that go their way, it wouldn't really matter how many more people they kill in their quest to enrich themselves and the people they actually care for.   It's interesting to watch from the outside, because none of the Republicans actually argue about whether Medicaid should stay or not. They are all absolutely agreed that they want to slash it. All they argue about is what it'll do to their chance for reelection. They really are truly evil people.
Author: OnDrugsTonight
